name: Minetta Tavern
address: 113 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: We boldly walked in on a Friday night for our anniversary and were seated at the bar after an hour wait - not too bad! You go for the atmosphere and the service, it was lovely. Drinks were delicious and we especially loved the squab and theâ€¦
Amazing burger and fries.
One of the best restaurants that Iâ€™ve been to in nyc! We ended up eating at the bar and it was worth the wait. Fantastic food, we had the tartare, bone marrow and the burger - very flavorful

Chic and intimate tavern with a great, bustling atmosphere. The energy inside was great. My party was able to snag bar seats quickly without a reservation, but itâ€™s definitely recommended to plan ahead. We all had the black label burger and it was fantastic! There seemed to be a mixup in the kitchen concerning the temperature of all three of our burgers, but they were kind enough to remake them. The fries were perfect and the fresh pickle was a nice addition. I canâ€™t wait to return and try more of the menu!

Le recensioni lo descrivono come uno dei migliori posti per hamburger, forse lo era una volta, prima che la concorrenza raggiungesse i livelli di oggi.
Lâ€™hamburger Ã¨ risultato senza lode nÃ© gloria: nulla di memorabile.
Non ci tornerei, anche se riconosco che la qualitÃ  degli ingredienti Ã¨ buona.
La â€œgoduriaâ€, perÃ², Ã¨ stata davvero bassa.
Personale gentile e locale molto caratteristico, ma nel complesso lâ€™esperienza non Ã¨ allâ€™altezza della fama.

An iconic New York establishment, the food is consistent and delicious. There is a reason why so many people recommend it. My friend got the burger and I got the special. Unreal martinis and coconut cake. I didnâ€™t care for the soufflÃ© but thatâ€™s just me. Oh and French onion soup was so great
Great ambience. The bartenders know their craft. The hostes and the assistant very nice and attentive. Great experience all together. The best place I went to during my recent visit to NY!

Only table we could get was 5pm on Thursdayâ€¦.and it was packed!!  Great burgers and steak and fab atmosphere.  A real NY experience, full of locals (we think!), and deserts are also worth a look if you have the time or appetite.  Would definitely recommend.
My favorite restaurant in all of NYC
Parada obrigatoria em NYC

In Minettaâ€™s glow, where whispers hum,
And laughter mingles with the rum,
There rests a burger â€” dark, divine,
A symphony of salt and brine.

A patty forged from beefâ€™s pure heart,
Where flavor meets the realm of art,
Each bite â€” a hymn of smoke and fat,
No gimmicks, gold, or fuss with that.

The bun, a stage of toasted grace,
Holds genius in its modest space,
And juices run like mellow wine,
A fleeting taste, near-sacred, fine.

No lettuce crown, no frilly leaf,
Just honest meat â€” belief in beef.
Youâ€™ll sit there quiet, eyes gone wide,
As time and hunger coincide.

So hereâ€™s my praise, sincere, unsaid â€”
For that Black Label in the red.
New York may change, may lose, may burn,
But that burger makes the world return
Great as always
Loved the food and the warm hospitality.
What a GEM! This is a classic NYC restaurant!
Hands down the best burger in New York, top presentation and attention to detail with a very thoughtful and doting staff! Always a pleasure eating here.

Dinner at Minetta Tavern was such a delight. The place has that timeless New York charm â€” lively, cozy, and a little glamorous. The service was smooth, the cocktails were classic, and the food was rich and perfectly done, especially the burger. Itâ€™s the kind of spot that never goes out of style.
ê¸°ëŒ€í•œ ê²ƒë³´ë‹¤ëŠ” ì†”ì§íˆ ë³„ë¡œ. ì•¤í‹°í¬í•œ ê°ì„±ì˜ ë°” ë¶„ìœ„ê¸°ëŠ” ì¢‹ì•˜ì§€ë§Œ í–„ë²„ê±° ë§› ìì²´ëŠ” ê·¸ëƒ¥ì €ëƒ¥.
The lamb ragÃº and steak frites were both fantastic

Hospitality and Service is the best... as good as it gets.
Classic New York City.
Great burger!!!

I came here for my birthday, I like to celebrate alone. Service was amazing. They gave me a complimentary glass of champagne as soon as I sat down. My waiter and all of the staff were incredibly welcoming and kind.

I ordered the radicchio salad and steak frites. The salad was great, used the bitterness of the radicchio as an asset to the dish. Leaned into the natural flavor but still kept it bright and light.

The steak (what I came for) was terribly undercooked. I asked for medium, it would be generous to say it was rare. Incredibly under salted, and the crust was nonexistent. Relied entirely on the bÃ©arnaise for any flavor. Fries were cooked well and stayed crispy.

I know everyone recommends the burger, I was just expecting steak frites at an old school, NY French restaurant to be solid as well.

Classy place, very friendly staff, starting with the nice hostess.  Got a booth in the back.  Ordered black label and regular burgers, bone marrow, French onion soup.  Had a great server who told us fries were cooked with refined peanut oil since a guest had a peanut allergy.  Refilled waters and drinks and checked on us a few times.  Oysters are amazing, not a single bad one and no grit either, so shout out to the shuckers.  One of my favorite places in the city, canâ€™t wait to go back.

Ordered a well-done burger, received a wildly cut open medium-rare burger.
They took it back to the kitchen and cooked it further, bringing back a terribly dry well-done burger, and didnâ€™t refresh the fries, so the fries had dried out under the heatlamp.
they comped the burger, but it wasnâ€™t worth eating.
Waitress claimed I said medium rare. shrug

Finally tried the black label burger here and I'm blown away. Also ordered the bone marrow which came in generous serving and a delicious onion jam. Whereas most places these days try so hard to impress with some experimental fusion that doesn't work, Minetta Tavern has the integrity to stick to the "basics" with absolute excellence.

Wonderful place to experience! So happy to have dinner at such a beautiful,  iconic place. We had the greatest waitress of all time... people like that truly make the experience worth every penny!! ...thumbs up to the chocolate souffle.....I want to go back for it tomorrow!!....and probably will..lol

Despite having the worst table in the restaurant (always a risk when you book a table for one) right next to the kitchen and the toilets I had the best service, delicious food (duck patÃª and then risotto) and cocktails made exactly as I asked. Itâ€™s a lovely restaurant, if expensive and definitely worth repeat visits.

A long wait is almost part of the ritual here we waited close to an hour before being seated. Yet once the food arrived, it was easy to see why the tables are so coveted. The aged meat was deeply flavorful, cooked with confidence, and paired beautifully with a wine list that is both broad and carefully chosen.

Despite the bustle and the wait, Minetta Tavern delivers a meal that feels unmistakably worth it.

this burger was def worth the wait. We walked in on a Sunday and the bartender was so friendly and served us drinks while we waited for a seat. Got the bone barrow and both burgers and WOW it was amazing
Amazing onion soup, amazing burger, great atmosphere. Saturday night walked in, waited an hour for bar seats, but went by fast because of the great vibes. Already excited for my next visit

Celebrated our 15 year anniversary here.  Honestly- our waiter Tony made this one of the most memorable NY dining experiences weâ€™ve ever had.  He was so warm and funny and wonderful it elevated our entire evening.  Would come back just for him!  And the food was incredible.

Came here for an anniversary - both of us now reflecting on how Minetta Tavern has been one of our favorite dining experiences in NYC.

All our food was superb, especially the foie gras, bone marrow and burger. Also adored the lobster salad and soufflÃ©s. Pair this with some martinis and wine you will be happy dining.

Honestly though, as great as the food, drink, and decor were, it was the service that made us truly feel like weâ€™d celebrated such a special occasion. Our server, StÃ©phanie, greeted us with champagne, and guided us through the menu so expertly, and coursed everything with natural timing.

It was a memorable and warming experience, and cannot wait to return!

I was on holiday in New York and decided to go somewhere nice since it was my birthday recently and chose the Minetta Tavern and am so glad I did.

I had initially reserved a table prior to leaving for my trip but as this was such a popular place, I could only manage to reserve a table for a late dinner at 10:30pm. On the day, I realized this was too late for me and arrived around 6pm instead to try my luck and I'm so pleased I did as I managed to get a stool at the bar  instead by waiting for maybe an hour, which wasn't so bad.

The staff were really nice and professional and the guys behind the bar were super friendly and exceptional at keeping everyone happy and informed how much longer they would need to wait for a place at the bar. Thank you to them especially for making my evening so special.

The food was incredible. I ordered The Black Label burger after seeing some of the reviews and everything that was said was true. It really is the best burger in NYC. I also had the apple tart for desert which was also very well made and tasty.

I highly recommend going here for dinner but you must reserve a table as early as you can as it get's super busy.

Went here with my husband for my 25th birthday in July and it instantly became one of our favorite restaurants ever. We had the truffle parmesan risotto with morel mushrooms, burrata salad with persimmon chutney, steak frites, escargot, and mussels frites, which were all amazing. The highlight was the chocolate soufflÃ©, which was like a fluffy cloud with the richest flavor. The atmosphere was intimate yet lively, perfect for a special night out. Canâ€™t wait to come back!
One of the best restaurantes in NYC, really great food and service.
At Minetta Tavern, the Black Label Burger is thick yet not greasy, melting beautifully in your mouth. The sauce, made from caramelized onions on top, strikes a perfect balance of savory and sweet.
If we could rate higher than a 5 we would, the stand out meal of our honeymoon. Absolutely loved it, fantastic service, incredible food, beautiful restaurant!!
Food was decent but the service at lunch today was very rude from the waitress with short black hair and tattoos â€¦ we will not be returning.

Absolute classic. A peak into a sadly missed era of New York, when people dressed like sharks, had two martinis before even looking at a menu, and talked to strangers at the restaurant bar. Keith McNally did this place justice and I hope it never changes.

Everything was amazing â€” the food was top-notch, and honestly, itâ€™s the only place Iâ€™ve ever really enjoyed a burger. Service was excellent, friendly, and on point.

The only downside was the noise level. One guy sitting nearby was screaming at us like an absolute jerk instead of talking like a normal person, which definitely killed the vibe a bit.

Otherwise, Minetta Tavern is fantastic. Food amazing, service the best, and overall a memorable experience. Yum! ğŸ”âœ¨

Light lunch with the tartare and black label burger. Tartare was excellent as was the burger, but the price point feels a bit off if only by a few dollars. Beef quality was great and had tons of dry-age funk as you would expect. Service was excellent and the atmosphere is classic.
Food was good. Had the burger and steak au poivre, both decent. Server was awesome! The wine by the glass selection was wonderful, and the chocolate souffle with vanilla ice cream was superb.
Great food, fantastic service, cool red light atmosphere, good wine list. Classy joint.

Fantastic burger - simple but with great ingredients, generous portions, and top quality meat - caramelized onions are making it top tier

Will defo be back!
One the best burgers I have ever had.  Quality of the meat gives you option to eat rare.
Old world bar with phenomenal food. Service is exceptional, bar none. One of the best burgers in NYC.

Esperienza unica
Lâ€™hamburger piÃ¹ buono di new york! Cocktail altrettanto buono! Prezzi nella media
George!!!!! Thank you for your phenomenal service. Your genuine care for the restaurant contributes to an amazing atmosphere. French dip was out of this world. Sit at the bar, you will not regret.

I can confirm that the rumors are true: this is, without a doubt, the best burger in NYC. It is a fantastic, juicy burger that is well-seasoned. Their onion soup is also a standout dish, and I highly recommend ordering it as a shared appetizer. The restaurant is small, so making reservations is essential! The interior is beautiful and has a lively, bustling atmosphere. The service is excellent. The prices are a bit on the higher side, but the experience is worth it!
una perla old style nel cuore della city
One of the best hamburgers I have ever had!

ë¹„ì‹¸ì§€ë§Œ ë§›ì‡ë‹¤

One of the best burgers in New York City! We didnâ€™t have a reservation and ended up waiting about an hour or two on a Friday night, finally sitting down for dinner around 11 PM. Even that late, the restaurant was still buzzing, intimate, packed, love the dark lighting , very romantic and full of that classic New York energy.

The service was a solid 10/10, attentive and friendly without being rushed. Of course, we ordered their famous burger, and it truly lived up to the hype .perfectly juicy, fresh, and flavorful.

Despite the wait, the whole experience was absolutely worth it. We had a lovely evening and will definitely be back.

Erstmal findet, man den Laden gar nicht weil er so dunkel und unbelebt aussieht, wenn man drin ist fÃ¼hlt man sich um glatte 60 Jahre zurÃ¼ckversetzt und erwartet jeden Moment, dass Frank Sinatra mit einigen Freunden reinkommt.
VÃ¶llig mitreiÃŸend.
Der Service ist fantastisch, das Essen gut - aber das Ambiente ist das Beste .....

This is the first time I sat at the bar instead of dining room in this charming vintage hotspot.  The bartender was attentive and engaging, and the customers were talking to and enjoying each other company without constantly looking at their phone. The food (burgers, steaks, fries, french dips, desserts) was amazing as always especially the bone marrow (smokey flavor and buttery with red wine shallots). Last but not the leastâ€¦.great selection of wine and beautifully crafted cocktails.

Easily one of our favorite burgers in the city!

We planned on trying to walk in at open, but decided to give them a quick call to see if they had anything available same day. We weren't expecting much as they had nothing online and it was Friday. Luckily, they had a 5:30 available - so definitely give them a call if you plan to swing by.

We ended up getting there about 20 mins early planning to just wait at the bar. But they were able to seat us immediately.

For food, we tried to get most of the popular items. Started off with the bone marrow for the app. It was rich but we felt like it was missing something - 3/5 (we also just had a much better bone marrow at quique crudo). For entrees we decided for the lamb pasta and the black label w/ gruyere per the recommendation of the waitress. The pasta was fine if a tad salty, 3/5. The burger was AMAZING and had such a unique taste. The only complaint was the burger was slightly overcooked - 4.75/5 (more of a medium to medium well than medium rare).

For desserts, we finished with the souffle w/ ice cream and cocounut cake. Either would easily feed two people but we wanted to try both. All of it was delicious and perfect way to end, 4.5/5.

Food came quickly and service was okay (started off well but tapered off towards the end where we had trouble getting the attention of the waitress).
Great atmosphere, and everyone greets and serves you with a smile, super friendly! The food was good, but we werenâ€™t exactly wowed by the steaks. We ordered the steak frites and the filet mignon.

My first time visiting Minetta Tavern, solo dinner reservation on a Friday night. Many sources call their Black Label Burger one of the best burgers in NYC. 10:45p reservation, arrived a couple minutes before, sat 10 min after my reservation. Ordered the Black Label Burger for $38, it came with fries. Only topping on the burger is caramelized onions, with an optional piece of lettuce and one tomato to add on. No cheese. Was very disappointed with this burger for the price, did not live up to the hype. Single patty of meat, pretty small. Aesthetically looks good, taste is definitely lacking. Could have been seasoned more and a bit dry. Had it cooked medium. Fries were nothing to ride home about. I give the burger a 3-4/10. I wonâ€™t be having it again, and would recommend you save your money and grab a burger from a local pub instead. Service was exceptional, and I was even offered a complimentary glass of champagne with my meal. 10/10 for service. Atmosphere is good, busy for a Friday night as expected. Dimly lit, loud restaurant. 7-8/10 for atmosphere.

This was a highly recommended spot, and on my first visit to Minetta Tavern I can happily say it exceeded every expectation I had. The hostesses were warm and welcoming, even offering me a seat at the bar while I waited for my table, which made the experience feel effortless from the start.

I ordered the steak frites, which was cooked perfectly and full of flavor, with fries that were crisp and golden. For dessert, I tried the crÃ¨me caramelâ€” rich, and absolutely faultless (but definitely large enough to share!).

A huge thank you to my servers, Tony and Luiz. Both were wonderful, Tony in particular made my first experience here so memorable with his incredible service and care.

Even the doorman was friendly and welcoming, kindly offering to let me wait by him while I called my Uberâ€”such a small gesture that left a big impression.

Iâ€™m already looking forward to my next visit!!

Food was almost spectacular, the Cesar felt like it wasn't washed properly so it was inedible but the bone marrow was rich and delicious. The burger was also very good. Almost as good as Lugers! We were assigned what felt like a new waitress but she did okay. She forgot a few things but upon review, we weren't charged for it.
Desert was great too!

I have been wanting to try Minetta Tavern for a while now, and I finally got the chance to go. The service was wonderful, and our food was amazing. My husband ordered the burger, and I got the filet, and we both enjoyed our meals. We will definitely be back, and I highly recommend both dishes. The drinks were also good. Itâ€™s a tight squeeze in there, but I expected that. It can get a little loud when the restaurant is in full swing, but we thoroughly enjoyed our experience and will be back!

Walked in at about 515pm on Friday and luckily got 3 seats at the bar which is first come first serve. The blue cheese olive martini was incredible! We had the black label burger which was a big, juicy, flavorful burger cooked to perfection. They had a soufflÃ© that you have to order 20 min in advance that was soooo delicious. Very nice old Manhattan restaurant.

Popular hotspot that rarely has reservation spots open at the usual dinner hours, so we decided to walk in for a late supper just after 10pm. It was easy to get a table. Service was excellent. The ambiance is especially charming with the low lights and nyc Italian vintage look. The place was lively too but not too loud - all in all a really great vibe.

We had the bone marrow (the biggest serving I've ever had), lobster salad (small but yum) and the steak frites. Everything was delicious. Lots of tables were having hamburgers so maybe I'll try that the next time.

Great old school restaurant vibe similar to Keen's with excellent service. 5 star tasty all around- risotto, French onion soup  and the black label burger. My only gripe is getting more bone than marrow on my rich, cholesterol busting bone marrow dish.

Place has a lot of mojo.  The building has been around since 1937 though the owners and food have changed throughout the years. Came in for the minetta burger and I thought it was worth the $38 price point. But definitely not a regular every day meal.  Id like to come back and try the steaks as well.

It is recommended to order without cheese and cooked medium rare ğŸ‘

Really excellent food served up in this iconic restaurant. The setting, staff and menu is really good. There was so much on the menu that Iâ€™ll have to return to try some other things. I went for the big name tickets and I wasnâ€™t disappointed.
ğŸ” The 8.5/10 Black Label Burger was top notch. The onions, patty and bun blended so well. Iâ€™d like a little more attention to detail on the bun (either fresher, toasted or  coated in some interesting flavour) it was just quite plain. That would be fine if it t was leaving space for the flavour of the patty or onions but it wasnâ€™t the case. The seasoning of the patty could have been better to really get that 10/10.
ğŸ¥© The 8.5/10 Bone in New York Strip was another strong hit. The fat could have been rendered better and there could have been more flavour from the flame but the cooking of the strip was very good. The best part was the peppercorn coating. Sharp and strong - special!

Minetta Tavern was an amazing experience from start to finish. We arrived before 5 a day early for our reservation, and they still gave us a table. There were bar seats available right away, so we would have been fine either way, but having a table made it even better.

Our server Elora was fantastic. She was attentive and made the whole night even more enjoyable. The restaurant goes from quiet to completely full in no time. We started with the onion soup, which was the best we have ever had. The flavors were perfectly balanced, not too salty or too sweet. The endive salad was just as delicious.

For our main courses, I had the Minetta Burger cooked medium rare, and it was perfect. Juicy and full of flavor. My wife had the filet au poivre, and it was just as great. Cooked perfectly and full of rich flavor. We finished with the chocolate soufflÃ©, which was the perfect way to end the meal.

The food, service, drinks, and atmosphere were all outstanding. Minetta Tavern absolutely lives up to the hype. We cannot wait to go back.
Amazing burger cooked perfectly! Great bar area too with super friendly bartenders.

Me and my wife ate the black label burger and it tasted better than what I imagine.
Service was great, our server and the whole crew were professional and attentive.
Canâ€™t wait to go back.
